I went through having headaches daily for 5 months straight through the winter months last year.  I finally had an MRI done, which only showed that I have a severely deviated septum.  Come to find out, my home had a rusted pipe that was disconnected from the furnace.  I had carbon monoxide in the basement that was under my bedroom.  We had it fixed, obviously, and I haven't had any problems this year with constant headaches.  I'm not saying that is what it is, but make sure you go to the doctor if the headaches don't stop.  We were pretty lucky I only had severe headaches!

Good morning.I think I would call my doc for 2 reasons...First, when I had bad headaches (I get menstrual migraines -- but pregnancy hormones also caused them for me)I didn't want to take even Tylenol.  My doc said it was more stressful to be in pain so try the Tylenol -- I did and it just took the edge off.  They did tell me if if didn't improve, they could give me something stronger that was safe to take when pregnant...I never got to that point though.Secondly, severe headaches can be a symptom of preeclampsia...there are many more sypmtoms of preeclampsia, and if you're being monitored, then BP, etc. would show if this was a concern...but I think I'd like to rule it out.BTW, I didn't see how far along you are...did I miss it?Lastly, dehydration also CAN be a cause of headaches and/or dizziness when pregnant.I prefer to be safe and check with the doc to rule out something more serious.LOL!!
